{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with altered sensorium, which could be due to various reasons. The tests listed are all relevant to the patient's symptoms. A complete blood count can help identify any underlying hematological disorder that may be contributing to the altered sensorium. Random blood sugar can indicate if hypoglycemia or hyperglycemia is present, which could also affect the patient's mental status. Lumbar puncture is necessary to rule out any central nervous system infections or inflammation that may be causing the altered sensorium. Non-contrast CT head is essential to identify any structural lesions in the brain that may be contributing to the patient's symptoms. Therefore, all of these tests should be done except...", "answer_choice": "B"}
